definition: the Way of the Hegemon/abbr. for 霸王之道/despotic rule/rule by might/evil as opposed to the Way of the King 王道/overbearing/tyranny/(of liquor, medicine etc) strong/potent
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
handsome high-powered businessman (a type of character in an eponymous genre of romantic fiction who typically has a soft spot for a girl of lower social status)

sentences.english: But no one pays attention to the arrogance of the company.
sentences.chinese: 但是没有人会关注这个公司的霸道。

sentences.english: There is no law and order and motorcycle gangs terrorize the country.
sentences.chinese: 世间没有法律和秩序，只有飞车党横行霸道。

sentences.english: The course of history has proved that the Afghan people are bullies.
sentences.chinese: 历史的进程已经证明我们阿富汗人是很霸道的。

sentences.english: His behavior toward the waiter was insufferably overbearing.
sentences.chinese: 他对待仆人的行为太霸道了。

sentences.english: The face of rape, not shrink Vinci, he continued to prepare the complaint, Tom.
sentences.chinese: 面对霸道，芬奇绝不畏缩，他预备继承为汤姆申说。

sentences.english: The more the reactionaries lash out, the more resistance they provoke.
sentences.chinese: 越是横行霸道，就越发激起更强烈的反抗。

sentences.english: With a brief, almost peremptory gesture he pointed to a chair.
sentences.chinese: 他做了一个简单的手势，近乎霸道地指着椅子。

sentences.english: The difference lies, therefore, in whether or not we can be certain of this person's bossiness .
sentences.chinese: 因此，差别就在于我们能不能确定这个人很霸道。

sentences.english: Boys a year older than the Qin-fen, but also able-bodied, very domineering.
sentences.chinese: 男孩比秦奋大一岁，又身强力壮，很霸道。

sentences.english: The street was overrun by the bullies last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年那些暴徒在街上横行霸道，无恶不作。
帮孩子找一些不那么霸道的朋友。

sentences.english: The Fascists once tyrannized a large part of the world.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯曾在世界很大范围内横行霸道。

sentences.english: Bullies are usually insecure and Russia is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 但霸道者通常心虚，俄国也不例外。

sentences.english: Xiao Ming is a bully, playing a long time also not retire.
sentences.chinese: 小明很霸道，玩了很长时间也不让位。

sentences.english: The last officer namely pure to don't comprehend clearly, this man why forever so arbitrary?
sentences.chinese: 上官清明不解，这个男人为什么总这么霸道？

sentences.english: During the Second World War, China had been overrun by Japanese invaders.
sentences.chinese: 二战期间，日本侵略者在中国横行霸道，无恶不作。
